ARABIC: تَكَادُ تَمَيَّزُ مِنَ ٱلْغَيْظِ كُلَّمَآ أُلْقِىَ فِيهَا فَوْجٌ سَأَلَهُمْ خَزَنَتُهَآ أَلَمْ يَأْتِكُمْ نَذِيرٌ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: It all but bursts with rage. Each time a group is flung into it its custodians will question them: 'Did no warner come to you?'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: As though it would burst with fury. Every time a crowd is thrown into it, its wardens will ask: "Did no warner come to you?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: as though it will burst with rage. Every time a multitude is cast into it, its keepers will ask them: “Did no warner come to you?”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: It almost explodes in rage. Whenever a group is thrown into it, its keepers will ask them, "Did no one come to warn you?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: As if about to explode with rage; whenever a group is thrown into it, the guardians of hell will ask them, “Did not a Herald of Warning come to you?”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: It almost bursts up with fury. Every time a group is cast therein, its keepers will ask: "Did no warner come to you"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Almost bursting for fury. Whenever a group is cast into it, its keeper shall ask them: Did there not come to you a warner?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: and wellnigh bursts asunder with rage. As often as a troop is cast into it, its keepers ask them, 'Came there no warner to you?';
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: As it would burst with rage. Whenever a (fresh) host is flung therein the wardens thereof ask them: Came there unto you no warner?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: as though bursting with rage. Each time a group is cast into it, its keepers will ask them, "Did no warner come to you?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Well-nigh it bursteth with rage. So oft as a company is cast thereinto, the keepers thereof will ask them: came there not Unto you a warner?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: almost exploding with rage. Whenever a group is thrown in it, its keepers will ask them, ‘Did not any warner come to you?’
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Almost bursting with fury: Every time a Group is cast therein, its Keepers will ask, "Did no Warner come to you?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: It almost bursts up with fury. Every time a group is cast therein, its keeper will ask: "Did no warner come to you?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: nearly bursting apart out of rage. Every time a host is cast therein, its keepers will ask them: 'Did no one come to warn you'
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: It almost bursts with fury. Every time a batch is thrown into it, its keepers will ask them, “Has no warner come to you?”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: It almost bursts with rage. Every time a company is thrown into it, its keepers ask them, "Did there not come to you a warner?"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [67:8] almost exploding (tamayyazu: a variant reading has the original [form] tatamayyazu) ripped apart, with rage, in wrath against the disbelievers. Whenever a host, a group of them, is flung into it, its keepers ask them, an interrogation of rebuke: ‘Did there not come to you a warner?’, a messenger to warn you of God’s chastisement.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: As it would burst with rage) towards the disbelievers. (Whenever a (fresh) host) of disbelievers, i.e. the Jews, Christians, Magians and all other disbelievers (flung therein) in Gehenna (the wardens thereof) the wardens of Gehenna (ask them: Came there unto you no warner) a warning messenger?
